paragraphs.title: Deploying Applications: Spring
paragraphs.text:
%md # Deploying Applications Splice Machine is an ACID compliant RDBMS, which means that you can build Spring applications on it. One such application is the commonly-used *Petclinic* web app. This notebook links to getting started with Splice Machine/Spring implementation of the Petclinic app. We won't go deeper in this tutorial but encourage you to follow up if this scenario is relevant to you. 1. Access the repository: https://github.com/splicemachine/spring-petclinic. 2. Download a JDBC driver to use with it: find the appropriate db-client-.jar for your application. There is also one you can extract from this Docker image. 3. Download an ODBC driver to use with it: https://www.splicemachine.com/get-started/odbc-driver-download/.

The Petclinic app uses the same basic Java persistence model as traditional databases, as shown here.

msg.data:
Deploying Applications

Splice Machine is an ACID compliant RDBMS, which means that you can build Spring applications on it.

One such application is the commonly-used Petclinic web app. This notebook links to getting started with Splice Machine/Spring implementation of the Petclinic app. We won’t go deeper in this tutorial but encourage you to follow up if this scenario is relevant to you.

  1. Access the repository: https://github.com/splicemachine/spring-petclinic.
  2. Download a JDBC driver to use with it: find the appropriate db-client-.jar for your application. There is also one you can extract from this Docker image.
  3. Download an ODBC driver to use with it: https://www.splicemachine.com/get-started/odbc-driver-download/.

The Petclinic app uses the same basic Java persistence model as traditional databases, as shown here.

paragraphs.text:
%md
## Where to Go Next

The next notebook in this class introduces you to [*Using the Splice Machine Native Spark DataSource*](/#/notebook/2DW6E5Z1X) to work with your database.

msg.data:
Where to Go Next

The next notebook in this class introduces you to Using the Splice Machine Native Spark DataSource to work with your database.

name: Splice Machine Training/For Developers, Part II - Intermediate/g. Creating Apps with Splice Machine
